metadata.titel_preek: The Great Promise: Rest for Your Soul

locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of Jesus' invitation to rest, the metaphor of the yoke, and the requirement of becoming like a child. Includes cultural references to Horace, Ibsen, and NYC history.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Deep exploration of the 'yoke' metaphor and the contrast between judgment and grace in Matthew 11.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the nature of spiritual restlessness and explains the mechanics of grace, while transitioning into an invitation (directive) and a promise (commissive) based on Christ's work.
voorbeelden: I want you to let me be the complete master of your life.
Jesus is saying, 'I'm the only one who can actually give you a solution to that.'
You must become a little child.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should abandon self-justification, feel the weight of their current 'yokes', and find relief in the finished work of Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The sermon relies on the 'revelation' mentioned in the text, but doesn't explicitly invoke the Spirit's current action in the room.

voorbeelden: Horace said no one lives content.
New York City was started as a trading post.
Jesus is the only one who can give you the deep inner rest.
It’s so lovely, soothing, and wonderful.
I can give you this illustration with a certain amount of authenticity.
He can turn to us and say, 'I took your restlessness, and I can give you my rest.'
God now looks at you and sees you righteous in Christ.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly grounded in the substitutionary atonement, providing a firm foundation for the hearer's trust.

voorbeelden: My Savior’s obedience and blood hide all my transgressions from view.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher uses the authority of the text and hymns to declare a new status, though often framed as a description of a state.

indicatoren: Extensive use of 'Jesus is saying' instead of 'Jesus says to you now'.
Lengthy cultural and historical illustrations (Horace, Ibsen, NYC history) that describe the human condition rather than addressing the hearer.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer gains a deep intellectual understanding of their restlessness but may remain an observer of the 'idea' of rest rather than a participant in the 'event' of receiving it.

missende_elementen: Present-tense sacramental address ('I announce to you today...')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' character is slightly muted by the 'teaching' character.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High clarity, specifically linking Christ's 'cosmic restlessness' to the hearer's rest.
voorbeelden: He can turn to us and say, 'I took your restlessness, and I can give you my rest.'

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes (grandparenting) and collective 'we' to build rapport.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Directly challenging the hearer's 'life lie' and yokes.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used effectively in the final third to apply the promise.

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'lecture' feel in the first half of the sermon.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about the human condition and NYC culture.

actueel_present.gebruik: The moment of application and prayer.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Restlessness) -> Declarative (Christ's work) -> Commissive (The Promise) -> Directive (Discipleship).
voorbeelden: Jesus took your restlessness (Assertive/Declarative) -> He gives you rest (Commissive) -> Take his yoke (Directive).
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Theologically robust; the imperative is strictly founded on the indicative of grace.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because he paid the penalty... he can turn to us and say 'I give you my rest'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: While heavy on constative explanation, the sermon successfully pivots to a performative event by grounding the hearer's identity in the substitutionary work of Christ.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He was getting a taste of the cosmic restlessness we deserve... so he can give you my rest.
sterke_punten.effect: Moves from 'talking about' rest to 'bestowing' it via the cross.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Horace said... Ibsen says... Judith Shulevitz wrote...
zwakke_punten.probleem: The first 50% feels like a secular philosophy lecture on restlessness.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon becomes an event when it moves to Gethsemane and the Cross, making the 'rest' a purchased reality for the hearer.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The use of 'Toezegging' (Promise) at the end functions as a means of grace.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, through the 'Word of the Lord' and the preacher's re-proclamation of Jesus' words.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Strong. The preacher speaks on behalf of Christ's invitation.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low textual evidence, though implied in the 'revelation to children'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher focuses on the 'how-to' of faith, which risks encroaching on the Spirit's domain of perlocution.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, specifically in the 'casting down of doing'.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: High in the description of the cross.
tekstueel_bewijs: Stand in Him, in Him alone, gloriously complete.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'Jesus is saying' (Assertive) to 'Jesus says to you' (Commissive/Declarative).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus is saying, 'I'm the only one who can give you rest.'
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Jesus stands here now and says to you: 'I give you rest.'
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a description of Jesus' ability to an active exercise of his power.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Maintain the current strength of the cross-centered promise.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because he was forsaken, you are accepted.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time spent on 3rd person 'wise and learned' and 'modern writers'.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Interweave the direct address earlier in the sermon.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, like Horace, may feel that no one lives content.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grounding the 'easy yoke' in the 'hard cross'. The performative power of the conclusion redeems the constative surplus of the introduction.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies the sermon not just as a message about rest (Information) but as the bestowing of rest (Declarative), which SvT's psychological model cannot capture.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power lies not in the clever NYC illustrations but in the illocutionary force of the Gospel promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'event' status is achieved when the preacher stops talking about the 'life lie' and starts declaring the 'righteousness of Christ'.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I took your restlessness, and I can give you my rest.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: The theological heart of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows a classic 'Kellerian' structure: identifying a cultural 'yoke' and replacing it with the 'Christ-yoke' through a performative promise.
